page.title: 11The Coach and Horses
page.content: Before the Coach and Horses was a pub it was a working dairy farm.In 1914 it was sold by Mr.Lancaster to a brewery for Â£1400.It was formally called the Fair House because the local farmers held a fair in the field by the pub during the 19th.century.The pub still has a cooking range,tiled floor,bar, parlour and 4 bedrooms.The landlord, Mr.Whitehead,sells Robinson's beer in 36 gallon barrels.He sells 12 barrels in the summer and 5 in the winter per week.Only a few barrels are wooden, most are metal.A pint of beer costs 76p,six years ago it cost 43p.He employs 21 staff at various times of the week.Mrs.Whitehead prepares food. They like to encourage families to come to the pub.They have a children's playground.Every year they hold a sponsored 5 mile run and they raise alot of money for charity.
